intro: Tafalla nutans, commonly known as the nodding tafalla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in racemes. Tafalla nutans is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique growth habit and floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
